Text: This week I will introduce legislation with @RepBrianFitz to impose sanctions on Russian parliamentarians who supported the Kremlin‚Äôs recognition of the Ukrainian regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent states. See the full legislation here: https://t.co/TMDLEEhGM2 https://t.co/2b5Hvbmuz9

Today, as Chair of the @HouseForeign Subcommittee on Europe, Energy, the Environment, and Cyber, I issued a bipartisan joint statement with Ranking Member @RepBrianFitz regarding  @KremlinRussia_E's decision to further invade Ukraine. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/VBKrhZU2v4

In that spirit, I commend @OlafScholz‚Äôs important decision to halt the NordStream 2 pipeline in the face of Russia‚Äôs violation of Ukraine‚Äôs sovereignty. The transatlantic community stands united and we will impose severe costs for Russia‚Äôs transgressions.

As a subcommittee chair on @HouseForeign, I am regularly in touch with @GermanAmbUSA and representatives from @GermanyDiplo. Their commitment to the transatlantic alliance and promoting the sovereignty of Ukraine has been unwavering.

Today @KremlinRussia_E has recognized the so-called ‚ÄúDonetsk and Luhansk People‚Äôs Republics‚Äù & sent Russian troops into Ukraine. Putin will pay for this deplorable decision. I pledge my support for a whole and independent Ukraine. See my full statement below:
 
#StandWithUkraine https://t.co/ySwoP2093d

Great reuniting with @tsikhanouskaya today during @MunSecConf. We discussed the democratic movement in Belarus facing repression by the Lukashenka regime, Russian threats to Belarusian independence, and ways Congress can support Belarusian civil society actors. https://t.co/cQEeJWIh1b
In conversations with colleagues in Congress and our transatlantic partners throughout Europe, the message is clear: We #StandWithUkraine in the face of Russian aggression.

In speaking with Kyiv Mayor @Vitaliy_Klychko in Munich earlier today, I was glad to have the opportunity to personally reaffirm the United States' support for the people of Kyiv and Ukraine as a whole. https://t.co/MTu3C6w08W

I strongly condemn the Russian-backed separatist attack in Ukraine's Donbas region, which hit a kindergarten & put innocent children at risk. These provocations are disturbing & unacceptable. I urge Russia and its proxies to fully respect the #MinskAgreements. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/B9IXwc3EAS

Today, on Ukraine‚Äôs National #UnityDay, we are updating our transatlantic letter of support with additional signatures. As transatlantic legislators, we #StandWithUkraine in the face of #Russian aggression. #UnitedWithUkraine https://t.co/IZc5WzgQVb

On #SaferInternetDay, I'm joining @RepSusanWild in calling on @YouTube to remove "How To Tie a Noose" videos. #SuicidePrevention means access to mental health services, suicide awareness and active digital citizenship. #TakeThemDown

We have a moral imperative to keep the promises we made to our Afghan friends and allies who worked alongside the US through 20 years of war. We call on the administration to provide the necessary resources for these operations for as long as it takes.

We welcome the appointment of Curtis Ried to the @WHNSC and look forward to @StateDept, @DeptofDefense, and @DHSgov working together to collaboratively address existing issues and long-term approaches to evacuation and resettlement operations.

This letter, written in coordination with the @AfghanEvac coalition, a group of 150+ NGOs working hand-in-hand with USG to continue this vital mission, outlines concrete steps the administration must take to make these operations more effective and efficient.

This week I led 81 House Members in sending a bi-partisan letter to @POTUS outlining vital steps that must be taken to streamline ongoing evacuation and resettlement efforts for our Afghan friends and allies. https://t.co/zy4sCODVHL

As I reflect today on the 50th anniversary of the Bloody Sunday massacre, I want victims‚Äô families to know that my support for them is unwavering. That‚Äôs why I introduced a bipartisan resolution to commemorate that fateful day and to continue support for the #GoodFridayAgreement.

‚ÄúPutin has reserves, financial reserves in place. He is playing his cards, and you can see them, because he is playing them in the open,‚Äù said Rep. Bill Keating, a Democratic lawmaker and chair of the House Foreign Affairs subcommittee on Europe.

https://t.co/OTuiwlBZXO
In recognition of the strong US-German bilateral relationship, I look forward to @POTUS welcoming @OlafScholz to the @WhiteHouse in February.

I am encouraged by @StateDept's strong comments today that NS2 will be halted if Russia makes any further incursion into Ukraine. As Chair of the House German Caucus, I regularly speak to my diplomatic colleagues and know Germany stands absolutely united with the U.S. and Europe.
My statement on the Russian-created crisis in Ukraine: https://t.co/viFec6BvmK
@ChadBown reminds us that supply chain and port delays are due to a demand side phenomenon - people are spending their budgets on increased goods, which is over stressing global logistics networks

I asked @WillyShih_atHBS how the US and EU can take advantage of private sector investment commitments to fight #climatechange. He said electrification and grid modernization present an opportunity to invest in forefront technologies
@WillyShih_atHBS says expanding supply chain capacities through long-term investment in leadership R&D will foster a marketplace of competing ideas in the US and the EU, something China does not have

@RepJimCosta and @ChadBown discussed increasing transatlantic cooperation for supply chain resiliency and reducing dependence on China. The US and the #EU should rely on each other as partners through the Transatlantic Legislators‚Äô Dialogue and the Trade & Technology Council #TTC
@RepSpanberger and @WillyShih_atHBS discussed incentives to adopt advanced manufacturing techniques to bolster domestic production in the Vice Chair‚Äôs district and across the nation
@WillyShih_atHBS says the US and #EU should invest in and transition to new process technologies to stay competitive in the semiconductor and rare earth industries
I asked @ChadBown what Congress can do to protect small business from supply chain disruptions and he supports limiting unilateral executive authority to impose tariffs
@ChadBown from @PIIE says transatlantic supply chain resilience initiatives are crucial for the US and EU to address chronic supply chain shortages

Whether we‚Äôre shipping cranberries from a bog in southeastern MA or manufacturing communication technologies in Asia, #SupplyChains are essential to everyday lives of Americans and Europeans, as I said to open today‚Äôs hearing.
STARTING AT 2PM EST: @WillyShih_atHBS, @ChadBown from @PIIE, and @DerekScissors1 will testify on transatlantic cooperation on critical supply chain security. https://t.co/HlYX3fRghv

Join me tomorrow at 2pm for a hearing on transatlantic cooperation on critical supply chain security. @WillyShih_atHBS, @ChadBown from @PIIE, and @DerekScissors1 will provide up-to-date information and analysis on this important topic.
While the current status of voting rights legislation in Washington is a finite disappointment, I refuse to lose hope.

We owe it to Dr. King and Congressman Lewis‚Äôs memories to get this legislation passed, and we owe it to the millions of Americans impacted by this proposed legislation to get it passed before the midterm elections.

John Lewis addressed the March on Washington just prior to Dr. King‚Äôs infamous ‚ÄúI have a Dream‚Äù speech and fought every day of his life to create the more-just union he laid out while standing before the Washington Mall.
That quote is what I hope we can focus on in the days ahead as we fight for passage of a voting rights bill that is named after my former colleague, the late Congressman John R. Lewis.
One of those leaders, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., taught us to ‚Äúaccept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.‚Äù
Their work weighs heavy on my mind after voting in favor of the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act last week only to see the legislation, once again, stall in the Senate.
There are two American heroes on my mind today ‚Äì both of whom delivered speeches before the March on Washington in 1963, and both fought endlessly for the passage of the Voting Rights Act in 1965.

.@KremlinRussia decision to permanently close @hrc_memorial, an organization focused on the preservation of the historical memory of the crimes committed during the #SovietUnion, is a direct attack on truth itself. As members of @HouseForeign we condemn this decision. @mfa_russia https://t.co/L6r3PvuPbR

But after weeks of briefings I‚Äôve had with our top military, intelligence, and diplomatic officials and with European leaders, I‚Äôm confident that these two imperatives will be delivered and acted upon if necessary. 5/5
Whether Putin is approaching these meetings in good faith is yet to be determined. 4/5
One, the solidarity between the US and our transatlantic allies is unshakable. ¬†And two, there will be a swift and severe price to pay for their aggression. 3/5

While this week‚Äôs three, major meetings among Russia, the US, NATO, and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe are not likely to produce a breakthrough resolution, Putin must come away from these realizing two things. 2/5
With 100,000 troops on the Ukraine border, Russia‚Äôs threat to Ukraine‚Äôs sovereignty is a real one. 1 /5

The @mitchellscholar was created following the historic 1998 Good Friday Agreement to promote continued intercultural dialogue and exchange between the United States and Ireland. Today, I led a letter, joined by 25 other Representatives, underlining its importance. #USIA https://t.co/exrxIWlyQN

Paul Whelan is a casualty of the lack of rule of law in Russia today. Through my position on @HouseForeign, I intend to continue my work with our transatlantic allies and partners as well as our newly appointed Ambassadors, to represent the people of #MA09 to confront the many crises facing our world today.

The confirmation of Ambassadors in France, Spain, Moldova, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Slovenia, the EU, Belgium, Sweden, & Switzerland, countries in the jurisdiction of my @HouseForeign Subcommittee, ensures the interests of all Americans, including in #MA09, are represented abroad.

Also confirmed was Mark Brzezinski as @USAmbPoland. Poland is a strong NATO ally & I am confident he will successfully represent US interests. I also know he will defend American values, including freedom of speech & rule of law, which have been under pressure in Poland.

Last week, the Senate confirmed over 40 ambassadorial nominees, including the Commonwealth‚Äôs own Claire Cronin as the new Ambassador to Ireland. I look forward to working with Ambassador Cronin to protect the #GoodFridayAgreement & strengthen the US-Ireland relationship. #mapoli

@Tsihanouskaya @ua_parliament @LRSeimas @PLParliament Together we call for new, free and fair elections in Belarus as well as an end to the continuing human rights abuses against peaceful protestors, activists and journalists. #StandWithBelarus

Today the Chairs of the Friends of Belarus Caucuses from the US, Ukraine, Poland and Lithuania join to condemn the unjust sentencing of Serhiy Tikhanovsky‚Äôs, former Presidential Candidate and husband of @Tsihanouskaya.  @ua_parliament, @LRSeimas, & @PLParliament #StandWithBelarus https://t.co/CSLg88IqZg

I paused today after leaving the House chamber to reflect on the gravity of the vote I will soon be taking to hold Mark Meadows in contempt of Congress. This will be the first time since the 1830‚Äôs that a former member has been held in contempt - not something taken lightly. https://t.co/WZgyktNIvj

I expressed my hope for the future integration of #Bosnia into the #EuropeanUnion and discussed long term solutions to current tensions in order to ensure peace and stability in the region. #BiH https://t.co/HBnyTlOPFs

Tevis, Moby, Mia and I enjoyed walking in the 58th annual Falmouth Christmas Parade earlier today. It was great to see folks out and about celebrating the season while staying safe. https://t.co/rAr996jROB

Yesterday, the US & allies imposed further sanctions on the Belarusian regime in response to the facilitated migrant crisis at the Poland-Belarus border. See my joint statement with Belarus Caucus co-chairs @RepMarcyKaptur, @JoeWilson, and Rep. Chris Smith. https://t.co/5ZP459fZ13

Today I met with Rear Admiral Juergen Ehle and EU Military Staff from @eu_eeas to discuss critical #EUDefense priorities, including the EU‚Äôs new Strategic Compass, #EU-#NATO cooperation, and our transatlantic partnership. https://t.co/G6wPAM9l6J

Thank you to the Mayors of the #PactOfFreeCities for testifying today. We must continue to protect our democratic institutions and support local leaders in their efforts to promote freedom and liberty throughout the world. @matusvallo @bpkaracsonyg @ZdenekHrib https://t.co/IpTAgAUsgb

Authoritarian regimes will continue attempting to erode democracy and the rule of law around the world. They may use military and economic tools to try and break our transatlantic unity. Their actions will not be successful if we stick together to promote democracy

@ZdenekHrib of Prague explains in his experience, authoritarian regimes start small by taking away funds from cities. He believes slowly these actions deplete resources so there is no money left to support municipal services and initiatives

@bpkaracsonyg says democracy must be promoted socHungary does not turn toward Russia or China. China only has economic interests in Hungary and wants to have access to the Western Balkan ports for their own advantage. The EU and US must keep a close eye on China

@matusvallo says social media companies are not protecting democracy enough. I couldn‚Äôt agree more - we can‚Äôt allow hurtful hate speech which targets minorities and marginalized communities to continue

@trzaskowski_ assured @davidcicilline he is doing everything in his power to protect minorities, especially the Jewish people and LGBTQI+ community. He was one of the first mayors to sign a charter protecting LGBTQI+ communities in Warsaw
@trzaskowski_ of Warsaw said on cyber issues, Poland is trying to teach young people about disinformation, cybersecurity, and propaganda

When I asked the mayors about climate change @matusvallo says Bratislava is working on planting 10,000 trees and @trzaskowski_ says Warsaw hopes to be carbon neutral by 2050. He also argued cities must take the initiative to address climate change on their own

@ZdenekHrib of Prague argued cities must protect democracy and defend human rights for all people. He is optimistic about the Pact of Free Cities and said the 21st century will be one of responsible, sustainable, and democratic cities
@trzaskowski_ requested Congress keep supporting Poland and not give up hope for Poland because democracy will be back. Poles have not given up fighting for democracy.

@trzaskowski_ of Warsaw asserted Poland has not turned into an undemocratic regime yet, even though the government has tried. He highlighted the resilience of its people, the strength of the parties of parliamentary opposition and the courage of Poland‚Äôs civil society

Mayor @bpkaracsonyg of Budapest is concerned by the decline of democracy in Hungary and in the wider world. He said this is a crisis of democracy and believes that urban centers have a responsibility to protect it, improve it, and drive us toward a better society

@matusvallo explained #CentralEurope is facing the rise of anti-democratic populism in many national governments. The crisis of leadership and public trust threatens liberal democracy worldwide. We must stand together for common democratic values and promote open societies.
.@freedomhouse recently warned democracy is being eroded around the world and notes increasing concerns related to rule of law and press freedom in #CentralEurope

Today the subcommittee is hearing from the mayors of four EU nations: Hungary, Poland, Czech Republic, and Slovakia, the founding members of the Pact of Free Cities. Each city is attempting to promote democracy and denounce corruption during challenging times.

Join me at 10am for a @HouseForeign Europe Subcommittee hearing on ‚ÄúInnovative Municipal Leadership in Central Europe: Founding Members of the Pact of Free Cities‚Äù where @matusvallo, @bpkaracsonyg, @ZdenekHrib, & @trzaskowski_ will testify. #CentralEurope https://t.co/ugwZygjwi9

Today I argued in a briefing on the Poland-Belarus border crisis that all roads lead back to #Russia. We need to strengthen messaging and sanctions with our European allies on Russia and Belarus.
@PavelSlunkin from @ecfr says the Lukashenka regime is manufacturing the border crisis and reflects the political crisis in Belarus since 2020. Lukashenka can end the crisis if he wants.

@AKendallTaylor from @CNASdc calls on Congress to continue to support our democracy effort in the region and should the situation continue, consider implementing sanctions on Belarus in coordination with our European allies

@mchancecnn is briefing us today on the dire situation at the Belarus-Poland border. He provided his firsthand account of the manufactured humanitarian crisis and just reported breaking news that the migrant camp along the border has been cleared. #belarus

NOW: Urgent update on the manufactured migrant & humanitarian crisis on the Poland-Belarus border. @AKendallTaylor from @CNASdc,@PavelSlunkin  from @ecfr, and @mchancecnn are providing up-to-date & analysis on this important issue. Updated link: https://t.co/zYMA9Ew846

Join me tomorrow at 9am for an urgent update on the manufactured migrant & humanitarian crisis on the Poland-Belarus border. @AKendallTaylor from @CNASdc, @PavelSlunkin from @ecfr, and @mchancecnn will provide up-to-date & analysis on this important issue. https://t.co/0Zw45pGOCr
I call on Azerbaijan and Armenia to come together, maintain their commitments to today‚Äôs ceasefire agreement, and work to establish a more peaceful and stable situation in the #SouthCaucasus.
I am deeply concerned about today‚Äôs development at the Azerbaijan-Armenia border. Although I welcome reports of a ceasefire, today‚Äôs escalation is unacceptable.

@paul_zukunft explained 12 of 31 US villages in the #Arctic are already looking to relocate to higher ground due to melting sea ice. We need to make the Arctic a priority and protect communities living in the region.
Dr. Natali from from @WoodwellClimate argues that in the Arctic, sea ice is THE infrastructure so we need to protect the melting sea ice in the region.

@dsdorough warns about the threats to marine life and habitat due to the lack of infrastructure in the Arctic region. We should work together across the #Arctic to build up infrastructure while still protecting the environment.
@paul_zukunft says the Arctic region is of great strategic importance to the US. He also calls on the US to ratify the Law of the Sea Convention.

As a member of the Inuit Circumpolar Council, @dsdorough says climate impacts are adversely affecting Inuit society as it relates to food security, displacement, health difficulties, and decreased biodiversity.

Dr. Natali from @WoodwellClimate says the world has already warmed 1.1 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, and the Arctic is warming at least two times faster than the global average. We must act now.
The US needs to focus on three goals in the #Arctic: a whole-of-government approach, collective action on climate change, and preservation of indigenous communities.

I attended @COP26 last week and saw firsthand the need to address global climate change. Scientists predict there will be no sea ice left in the #Arctic by the end of the 21st century. We must seek to protect this strategically important region.

Please join me at 10am for a @HouseForeign Europe Subcommittee hearing on national security impacts of climate change in the #Arctic with @paul_zukunft @dsdorough @LukeDCoffey and Dr. Susan Natali from @WoodwellClimate https://t.co/26md3mwCXS

A serious sense of excitement at the White House as @POTUS signs the infrastructure bill - and there should be a serious sense of excitement on Cape Cod & the Islands, too, as this new law contains $40bil worth of funding to target for the Cape Cod Canal Bridge replacement.
The #BIF is a big deal for Massachusetts - billions for roads, bridges, water, airports, climate residency and so much more!

I am on my way to the White House to join President Biden and my colleagues as the Bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is signed into law. I am incredibly proud to have voted for this legislation, and I am excited to see it signed into law this afternoon. https://t.co/ibfNOsKzCz
To all who have served to defend our nation, I extend my deepest gratitude today and always: Thank you for your service.

Today‚Äôs experience of being in Europe at the 11th hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month was particularly meaningful knowing how many American troops have served here during the two world wars and in the ensuing decades of peace.

Today we thank and remember the sacrifices of the men and women who have served our nation and the families that have sacrificed alongside them. I was able to observe Remembrance Day this morning in Scotland alongside members of Her Majesty‚Äôs Armed Forces. https://t.co/56axJbZuvb

Transformative change has a price tag attached to it, but so too does the status quo. We are behind the rest of the developed world on infrastructure, but with the President‚Äôs signature the United States is getting back in the driver‚Äôs seat.
Opponents of this legislation don‚Äôt want you to know what is in it - they just want to scare you with big numbers.
‚Ä¶roads, bridges (including funds that will be available for the Cape Cod Canal bridge replacement projects,) public transit, water quality, broadband access, and so much more.
Millions of good jobs will be created and millions of lives will be impacted by this massive investment in the things that impact our daily lives:

I‚Äôve served under three administrations, and all three have promised infrastructure deals. Yet after months of negotiations and a late night of votes, President Biden was the first to make it happen.
Today @RepSchneider @repgregorymeeks and I introduced a resolution affirming the US commitment to combatting climate change and welcoming our full return to @COP26. https://t.co/95fvjZHr6M

When asked about the Serbia-Kosovo dispute, DAS Escobar says he believes EU-led dialogue is the only forum where both sides can find common ground solutions and discuss their concerns. He encourages all parties to be pragmatic and flexible in their discussions.

I asked DAS Escobar what can be done to end the North Macedonia-Bulgaria dispute. He argued it‚Äôs in our strategic interest to bring Albania and North Macedonia into the #EU and he also called for a timeline for discussions by the end of the year.

I agree with DAS Escobar that the US should promote peace, stability, and prosperity in the #WesternBalkans and supports the EU-facilitated dialogue as the best path to normalizing Serbia-Kosovo relations
DAS Escobar from @StateEUR underscored in his testimony today the US commitment to supporting the successful integration of the #WesternBalkans into European institutions and eventually the #EU

I call on the #EU to expedite the accession process so North Macedonia and Albania can begin talks by the end of the year. The US and Congress are advocates of progress in the region and support the #WesternBalkans desire to join the #EU

Today DAS Gabriel Escobar from @StateEUR will testify on the #WesternBalkans at a @HouseForeign hearing on U.S. Engagement in the Western Balkans. See my statement on the region: https://t.co/JKDpmkYlTL
Please join me at 11:30am for a @HouseForeign Europe Subcommittee hearing on US Engagement in the #WesternBalkans with DAS Gabriel Escobar from @StateEUR https://t.co/w1u9pZbdWo

As @celtics fans we should take pride in @EnesKanter - a true leader in using his pulpit to fight for freedom, regardless of the consequences. The people of Tibet and Turkey are lucky to have him on their team, too.
Today I asked @jakeclevine how the US can balance human rights with the environmental impacts and he reassured me that the US is committed to eliminating forced labor from supply chains.

Many have argued the US shouldn‚Äôt move forward on climate issues because other countries aren‚Äôt committed to working on their carbon emissions. In my opinion, that is nonsensical and a poor reason to not address climate change.
As we prepare for #COP26, now is the time to work on mitigating the effects of climate change and working towards building climate-resilient communities around the world.

Pleased to join @JoaquinCastrotx at 10am for a joint hearing on Climate Change and Int'l Dev. with the Europe, Energy,  Environment, and Cyber and the International Development, International Organizations, and Global Corporate Social Impact subcommittees. https://t.co/Tbb0IY72rE

Why is it that whenever Ted Cruz is facing a crisis in Texas his mind seems to wander to vacation destinations? First it was Cancun, now it‚Äôs Nantucket and Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. Last week he voted to default on our nation‚Äôs debt, now he‚Äôs wasting resources on lame political stunts.
Every action Congress takes moves us one step closer to ensuring Paul‚Äôs release. I greatly look forward to the day when Paul is free again. (3/3)

Next week, during the Foreign Affairs Committee markup, we will consider House Resolution 336 that reiterates our call for Paul‚Äôs release. Thank you to Rep. Haley Stevens for your leadership on this issue and to Chair Gregory Meeks for allowing its consideration. (2/3)

Yesterday marked 1,000 days of imprisonment for unlawfully convicted political prisoner Paul Whelan. I remain committed to doing everything possible to ensure Paul‚Äôs freedom and am reassured by the strong bipartisan support for him in Congress. (1/3)

Olivier Onidi says US and EU security is collective and the 9/11 attacks were the driving force behind transatlantic counterterrorism partnership over the last two decades. Our shared values have allowed us to think creatively about our problems. @EUHomeAffairs

@DavidCicilline and @Vidhya_ra  agree terrorism prevention needs to be locally driven and we should focus on local programs conducted by social workers and other practitioners to combat radical online extremism.
@Levitt_Matt Argues the risk and likelihood of another 9/11 attack is ‚Äúmuch smaller now‚Äù thanks to the infrastructure the US has put in place.
@raffpantucci We need greater cooperation and coordination when evaluating terrorism threats in Europe and North America. We can prevent terrorism together.
@Vidhya_ra from @MoonshotTeam shared during her testimony on the @HouseForeign that to combat global terrorism the US should not focus on ideology but instead the ideological spectrum.

Please join us at 2pm for a joint hearing on Transatlantic Cooperation on Countering Global Violent Extremism with the Europe, Energy, the Environment and the Cyber, Middle East, North Africa and Global Counterterrorism subcommittees.
 https://t.co/J26jM1ookK

I strongly support the Slovak government‚Äôs apology for crimes it committed against its own people, including Jewish citizens. With many marginalized communities at risk today, we must strive for accountability to ensure groups at risk never face the horrors of past generations. https://t.co/QYSpEhsZMs

We owe it to our country, and we owe it to the thousands of innocent victims, first responders, and fallen heroes who aren‚Äôt here today because of a Tuesday morning that we will never forget. üá∫üá∏

As we mark this solemn anniversary, I hope that we can all summon the energy to restore that sense of togetherness, patriotism, and common purpose we felt as Americans after September 11 ‚Äì not just today, but every day.

We have had successes ‚Äì Osama Bin Laden is dead, attempted terrorist attacks have been thwarted, and the world is a safer place with increased international cooperation ‚Äì but those victories serve as no consolation to those who have lost a child, a spouse, a parent, or a friend.

We will never forget what happened on September 11. We will never forget those who lost their lives and were injured in Afghanistan and Iraq, and we will never forget the sacrifices that their families have made in the ensuing years.

But we must also remember how we mobilized as a nation and came together as one after September 11, and we must take that memory and move forward to see how we can work together to solve the problems we face both domestically and internationally.
The twentieth year of U.S. forces coming home with injuries that will impact them and their families for the rest of their lives.
And, sadly, as we saw just two weeks ago, it is the twentieth year of brave Americans making the ultimate sacrifice for our nation as a result of the War on Terror.
It‚Äôs also the twentieth year of first responders suffering from medical issues, the result of their courageously rushing through the ash and smoke to Ground Zero to save lives.

Today also marks the start of the twentieth year of missed birthdays for the children who never had the chance to get to know their parent, the twentieth year of missed wedding anniversaries, the twentieth year of mourning.
But today is not just the 20th anniversary of a cowardly attack on our nation.
We remember the horror we felt as we heard the news on that quiet Tuesday morning ‚Äì I was in my car on my way to the office when I heard it on the radio.
We remember the images of falling towers, a smoldering Pentagon, and the field in Shanksville where courageous passengers and crew died as heroes.
We remember the more than 6,000 injured.
We remember the 2,977 innocent lives lost.
Today we remember.

We must move forward in this mission to honor those lost yesterday, the tens of thousands killed and wounded in Afghanistan over the past two decades, and the Gold Star families they have left behind.
The United States will not waver in our commitment to continue the evacuation of United States citizens and Afghan allies in the face of terrorism.

The loss of any US service member is devastating, but these attacks, taking advantage of a precarious situation to inflict harm on U.S. personnel and desperate crowds, have underscored the brutal nature of terrorist elements in the region who we have fought so hard to eradicate.

The brave service members killed and wounded in the attacks at Hamid Karzai International Airport were on the front lines of an extraordinary, heroic effort. I extend my deepest condolences to the families of these heroes who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.

I want to thank partner countries for their generous support and assistance in the Afghan evacuation operation. Citizens, visa holders, and at-risk Afghans must be kept safe and our international partners are instrumental in this effort. https://t.co/psTUPzQTeu

Today I joined a number of colleagues in asking @POTUS for answers about efforts to assist fleeing Afghans, including my question about rescuing activists who fought for the rights of women & girls who are now at risk. Thank you to @RepSaraJacobs for leading this effort. https://t.co/1ysRyuAMgr
The horrors that we are witnessing in this withdrawal can only be mitigated by the utmost effort to save those who stood with us.
Few can argue with the decision to end this two-decade war, but there should be no artificial timeline that constrains this effort.
This includes interpreters, human rights organizers, journalists, contractors, and others. We must also include those activists fighting for women‚Äôs rights in Afghanistan.

While two decades of political decisions will be the subject of Congressional oversight and historical review, urgent actions are necessary now to provide safe passage of U.S. Citizens and Afghan allies whose lives are in jeopardy under Taliban rule.
I witnessed, first hand while in-country, the efforts of our military to root out the terrorists who attacked and waged war on our homeland.
Thousands of American servicemembers made the ultimate sacrifice in Afghanistan, and tens of thousands more will live every day with wounds, visible or not, sustained in theater.

First and foremost, we must recognize and offer our deepest gratitude to the professionalism, commitment, and sacrifice of those who serve and have served in-country, and to their families here at home.
The most up-to-date information that we have is that flights have resumed out of the airport in Kabul and access to the airport is currently being regulated.
We have had some early success in assisting individuals on the ground in Afghanistan, and will continue to work to ensure that all Americans and allies are able to transit safely.
Our office is currently working on a number of Afghan visa cases directly with the Department of State and we stand ready to assist further as additional cases come in.

I want to thank all of today's witnesses for sharing their testimony at today's important hearing. The US remains firmly committed to @NATO, and we will continue to bolster the transatlantic alliance to meet current and future challenges.

On @climate, @Gottemoeller says #NATO "has turned its attention to this in a significant way" after this month's summit. I wholeheartedly endorse further commitments by #NATO to combatting security impacts of @climatechange.

In response to a question from @RepSchneider on what Congress can do to demonstrate US commitment to #NATO, @IvoHDaalder says emphasizing that the American people stand firmly behind NATO is an important reminder that NATO meets both US & allied security interests.

.@RepSusanWild is asking what the US can do with @NATO allies to promote cooperation and communication with #Turkey. @AndersFoghR says "words matter" and the US should seek to prevent further Turkish-Russian military cooperation.

Now a question from @repdinatitus on @NATO's involvement in responding to #Russia's Arctic expansion. @AndersFoghR says NATO must adopt a clear Arctic strategy. "Russia is about to militarize the Arctic," he says.
Wess Mitchell says the ultimate goal must be the internal cohesion of @NATO. "The right role for #NATO is to focus on the intersection of democracy with external security threats."

.@GerryConnolly @natopapress is asking about military readiness beyond the 2% GDP @NATO commitment. @IvoHDaalder says "we need a fundamental recommitment to defense by our European allies... We need to spend our time talking about readiness & investments in real capabilities."
In response to my question on @NATO expansion, @Gottemoeller recommends "working from the inside out" through local offices on fighting domestic corruption and promoting reforms.

When it comes to cyber, "the best defense may be a good offense" says @IvoHDaalder. "@NATO will need to develop the doctrine and capabilities to employ cyber offensively to enhance deterrence of cyber attacks."

.@Gottemoeller highlights the need for a new strategic concept for @NATO to meet the challenges of this decade and beyond, continued work on burden sharing commitments, and a focus on democratic resilience.
Insightful words from @AndersFoghR: "@NATO has been a successful peace movement for nearly 75 years...because of two strengths: a capacity to adapt and determined American global leadership."

@AustinScottGA08 on the challenges facing @NATO: "As we focus on countering #China & #Russia aggression & the expansion in the Arctic, there's also an urgent need to address cyber security and cyber defense threats" posed by the two countries.

@GerryConnolly, President of @natopapress says, ‚ÄúAs @NATO the SG has observed, #China demands our attention not because the alliance seeks to move into the South China Sea but because China is increasing its influence & expanding its activities in the Euro-Atlantic region.‚Äù

With new and emerging threats from traditional and non-traditional sources, @POTUS‚Äô renewed commitments to our transatlantic alliances and the role of American leadership @NATO has never been more important than it is now.

Join me at 10am for a hearing on #NATO & #NATO2030 with the @HouseForeign Subcommittee on Europe, Energy, the Environment, & Cyber. Testimony from fmr Denmark PM & NATO SG @AndersFoghR, fmr Deputy SG @Gottemoeller, and fmr #US Amb @NATO @IvoHDaalder. https://t.co/0bLvLxc8XU
